title: China holds 2019 Uganda Wetland Protection and Management Technology Overseas Training Course
description: On December 3, 2019, China held the opening ceremony of the  2019 Uganda Wetland Protection and Management Technology Overseas Training Course. 50 students in the overseas training program participated in the opening ceremony. The duration of the program is three weeks. This project was put together by the Nanjing University (Changshu) Ecological Research Institute.  The opening ceremony of this training course was held in Kampala in conjunction with the opening ceremony for the 2019 Ugandan Engineering Construction Staff Professional Skills Overseas Training Course ( project #88232). As of this training course, about 4,500 have attended Chinese training programs.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION

# Title
China holds 2019 Uganda Wetland Protection and Management Technology Overseas Training Course

# Description
On December 3, 2019, China held the opening ceremony of the  2019 Uganda Wetland Protection and Management Technology Overseas Training Course. 50 students in the overseas training program participated in the opening ceremony. The duration of the program is three weeks. This project was put together by the Nanjing University (Changshu) Ecological Research Institute.  The opening ceremony of this training course was held in Kampala in conjunction with the opening ceremony for the 2019 Ugandan Engineering Construction Staff Professional Skills Overseas Training Course ( project #88232). As of this training course, about 4,500 have attended Chinese training programs.
justification: Project focuses on environmental protection training without direct energy transition implications
evidence: Wetland protection and management technology training course, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Sinohydro funds the Masindi Barracks Health Centre IV renovation and expansion in Uganda in 2019
description: On October 11, 2019, a groundbreaking ceremony was held for the Masindi Barracks Hospital project donated by China Electric Power Uganda Karuma 812 Joint Venture, which is effectively controlled by Sinohydro (China Water Resources and Hydropower Construction Corporation). The purpose of the project is to expand and transform the existing hospital, including a new operating room, laboratory, doctor's dormitory, nurse's dormitory, canteen, and the renovation and repair of some original buildings. Originally, the project was expected to finish in 8 months, but it was delayed because of the COVID-19 Pandemic. It was originally expected to cost $1.5 million, but eventually it cost $1.7 million.  The project was constructed by local company Excel Construction ltd. and was finished on April 16, 2021 under the witness of officials from the Chinese companies and Uganda People's Defense Force (UPDF).
staff_comments: The Masindi Barracks Health Centre IV is also known as Masindi Barracks Military Hospital and 马辛迪军营医院 in Chinese.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Sinohydro funds the Masindi Barracks Health Centre IV renovation and expansion in Uganda in 2019

# Description
On October 11, 2019, a groundbreaking ceremony was held for the Masindi Barracks Hospital project donated by China Electric Power Uganda Karuma 812 Joint Venture, which is effectively controlled by Sinohydro (China Water Resources and Hydropower Construction Corporation). The purpose of the project is to expand and transform the existing hospital, including a new operating room, laboratory, doctor's dormitory, nurse's dormitory, canteen, and the renovation and repair of some original buildings. Originally, the project was expected to finish in 8 months, but it was delayed because of the COVID-19 Pandemic. It was originally expected to cost $1.5 million, but eventually it cost $1.7 million.  The project was constructed by local company Excel Construction ltd. and was finished on April 16, 2021 under the witness of officials from the Chinese companies and Uganda People's Defense Force (UPDF).
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Renovation and expansion of health center, including new operating room, laboratory, and dormitories

title: China sends 20th batch of medical aid teams to Uganda in 2019
description: On October 9, 2019, China's 20th medical team to Uganda left China for the country. On October 14, 2019, the Chinese Embassy welcomed the new team and held a farewell ceremony for the 19th team in the China-Uganda Friendship Hospital in Naguru. The team began working on the next day.  The 9 team members are from Third Affiliated Hospital of Kunming Medical University, Yunnan Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital, and Yunnan Province Infectious Disease Hospital. The doctors specialize in Head and Neck Surgeries, anesthesiology, abdominal Surgeries, Urology, colorectal surgeries, infectious diseases, and acupuncture.  During their tenure, the team taught local doctors the techniques of Laparoscopic appendectomy and held lectures on acupuncture. Originally, they planned to stay for one year, but they stayed longer because of the pandemic. The team finished their tenure on January 24, 2021.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends 20th batch of medical aid teams to Uganda in 2019

# Description
On October 9, 2019, China's 20th medical team to Uganda left China for the country. On October 14, 2019, the Chinese Embassy welcomed the new team and held a farewell ceremony for the 19th team in the China-Uganda Friendship Hospital in Naguru. The team began working on the next day.  The 9 team members are from Third Affiliated Hospital of Kunming Medical University, Yunnan Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital, and Yunnan Province Infectious Disease Hospital. The doctors specialize in Head and Neck Surgeries, anesthesiology, abdominal Surgeries, Urology, colorectal surgeries, infectious diseases, and acupuncture.  During their tenure, the team taught local doctors the techniques of Laparoscopic appendectomy and held lectures on acupuncture. Originally, they planned to stay for one year, but they stayed longer because of the pandemic. The team finished their tenure on January 24, 2021.
justification: Project is focused on medical aid and knowledge transfer, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment, focus on healthcare services and training, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Embassy offers 30 Ugandan university students scholarships at Makerere University worth UGX 105 million in 2019 (Linked to #88280)
description: On September 6, 2019, the Chinese Embassy offers 30 scholarships to the same group of students that received the scholarships in 2018 at Makerere University. In February 2019, the Chinese Embassy offered another 105 million Shillings to support these students for their 3rd year of study. The students were chosen from many applicants from different colleges of Makerere University who were underprivileged but academically outstanding. There are two scholarships that were granted: the Ambassador’s Award for Excellence and the Ambassador’s Award for Friendship to Makerere University continuing students.   Prof. Barnabas Nawangwe, the Makerere University Vice Chancellor on Thursday hailed the people of the Republic of China for their generosity towards Makerere University and for supporting students' access to higher education.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title

# Description
On September 6, 2019, the Chinese Embassy offers 30 scholarships to the same group of students that received the scholarships in 2018 at Makerere University. In February 2019, the Chinese Embassy offered another 105 million Shillings to support these students for their 3rd year of study. The students were chosen from many applicants from different colleges of Makerere University who were underprivileged but academically outstanding. There are two scholarships that were granted: the Ambassador’s Award for Excellence and the Ambassador’s Award for Friendship to Makerere University continuing students.   Prof. Barnabas Nawangwe, the Makerere University Vice Chancellor on Thursday hailed the people of the Republic of China for their generosity towards Makerere University and for supporting students' access to higher education.
justification: Project is focused on education scholarships without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for university students, focus on education access and support

title: Chinese Government provides USD 137 million grant to purchase medical equipment for Ukrainian hospitals
description: On January 16, 2019, Ukrainian Minister of Economic Development and Trade of Ukraine Stepan Kubiv signed an agreement with the Chinese government, under which China will grant Ukraine USD 137 million in technical assistance for the provision of modern medical equipment. Specifically, this grant will be used to purchase 230 units of medical equipment that will be used at hospitals in the Kherson, Ivano-Frankivsk, Vinnytsia, Zaporizhia and Dnipropetrovsk regions of Ukraine. The equipment includes tomographs, linear accelerators, multifunction monitors, X-ray equipment, cardiac/interventional angiography systems, and microscopes.  Discussions of the donation began in May 2016 when the Ukrainian Ministry of Economic Development and Trade requested medical equipment on behalf of the Ukrainian Ministry of Health in the form of free assistance from the Government of China. In May 2019, Minister of Economic Development and Trade Stepan Kubiv announced that Ukraine had received the USD 137 million in technical assistance at a government meeting.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides USD 137 million grant to purchase medical equipment for Ukrainian hospitals

# Description
On January 16, 2019, Ukrainian Minister of Economic Development and Trade of Ukraine Stepan Kubiv signed an agreement with the Chinese government, under which China will grant Ukraine USD 137 million in technical assistance for the provision of modern medical equipment. Specifically, this grant will be used to purchase 230 units of medical equipment that will be used at hospitals in the Kherson, Ivano-Frankivsk, Vinnytsia, Zaporizhia and Dnipropetrovsk regions of Ukraine. The equipment includes tomographs, linear accelerators, multifunction monitors, X-ray equipment, cardiac/interventional angiography systems, and microscopes.  Discussions of the donation began in May 2016 when the Ukrainian Ministry of Economic Development and Trade requested medical equipment on behalf of the Ukrainian Ministry of Health in the form of free assistance from the Government of China. In May 2019, Minister of Economic Development and Trade Stepan Kubiv announced that Ukraine had received the USD 137 million in technical assistance at a government meeting.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare equipment provision without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Purchase of medical equipment for hospitals, healthcare sector focus

title: Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Music Center at the P.I. Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine
description: On June 10th, 2019, the unveiling ceremony for the Confucius Music Center was held in Kiev, Ukraine. It was established at the P.I. Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine jointly with the Central Conservatory of Music (CCM) in Beijing with the support of the Confucius Institute Headquarters (Hanban). This is the first Music Confucius Institute classroom in Ukraine and also the first one in the world. According to the Chinese Embassy in Ukraine, the purpose of this classroom is to promote Chinese culture and music in Ukraine.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Hanban provides grant for establishment of Confucius Music Center at the P.I. Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine

# Description
On June 10th, 2019, the unveiling ceremony for the Confucius Music Center was held in Kiev, Ukraine. It was established at the P.I. Tchaikovsky National Music Academy of Ukraine jointly with the Central Conservatory of Music (CCM) in Beijing with the support of the Confucius Institute Headquarters (Hanban). This is the first Music Confucius Institute classroom in Ukraine and also the first one in the world. According to the Chinese Embassy in Ukraine, the purpose of this classroom is to promote Chinese culture and music in Ukraine.
justification: Project focuses on cultural exchange and education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Music Center for cultural promotion, education sector focus

title: Chinese Government grants 52 units of emergency response equipment worth RMB 95 million to Ukraine (linked to #66056)
description: On December 26, 2019, the Chinese Government handed over 52 pieces of emergency response equipment worth RMB 95 million ($13.6 million) to the State Emergency Service (SES) of Ukraine. This batch of equipment included 16 fire hoists and fire ladders, 16 truck cranes, 10 bulldozers, and 10 graders. This project was funded with the grant proceeds from an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) that the two governments signed in April 2019 (see linked umbrella project ID #66056).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title

# Description
On December 26, 2019, the Chinese Government handed over 52 pieces of emergency response equipment worth RMB 95 million ($13.6 million) to the State Emergency Service (SES) of Ukraine. This batch of equipment included 16 fire hoists and fire ladders, 16 truck cranes, 10 bulldozers, and 10 graders. This project was funded with the grant proceeds from an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) that the two governments signed in April 2019 (see linked umbrella project ID #66056).
justification: Project involves emergency response equipment donation with no direct energy or environmental impact
evidence: Emergency response equipment including fire hoists, ladders, truck cranes, bulldozers, and graders

title: Chinese Embassy in Ukraine donates quilts and cash envelopes to orphans in Kiev
description: On February 1, 2019, the Chinese Embassy in Ukraine invited 60 orphans to the embassy and gave each of them a red envelope and a quilt. In accordance with Chinese tradition, the red envelope symbolizes good luck and the quilt represents warmth. The children were from the Pecherskyi District of Kiev, where the embassy is located. The district chief and the first deputy chief of the district were present.
staff_comments: It is traditional for red envelopes containing money to be given as gifts during Chinese New Year, so it is assumed that the red envelopes referenced in the Chinese Embassy articles contain cash, although this is not explicitly stated.
combined_text:

OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

The district chief and the first deputy chief of the district were present.
justification: Project is a social welfare initiative with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of quilts and cash envelopes to orphans, social welfare focus

title: Chinese Embassy in Ukraine donates sports equipment to the 90th School of Kiev City
description: On May 30, 2019, the Chinese Ambassador to Ukraine visited the 90th School of Kiev City in the Pecherskyi district to celebrate International Children's Day. The embassy donated sports equipment such as footballs, basketballs, volleyballs, table tennis equipment, and gymnastics mats. They also gave the children Chinese knots and rattles.

title: Chinese Consul General in Odessa Donates Books to the Chinese Studies Center of Odessa Maritime University
description: On March 4, 2019, the Chinese Consul General in Odessa attended the opening of a photo exhibition celebrating 40 years of China's opening up and reform. At the event, he donated copies of "Xi Jinping: The Governance of China" to the Chinese Studies Center at Odessa Maritime University.
